page.title: 12WYVERN BARRACKS
page.content: Wyvern Barracks is situated on a site rising on a slope from south to north. From south-north the area consists of parade ground,museum,and administration blocks.Servicemen's quarters are adjacent to football and cricket pitches;also a tennis court. The north-east corner is being developed for the Inland Revenue. For the last decade the barracks have not housed a regiment of soldiers.It is hoped a new regiment will shortly join the 43 Brigade and accommadate the sevices already there. The barracks has facilities for helicopters to land and is used for accident emergencies and by visiting dignatories,eg.The Royal Family.
